703317f-a.title: Brooklyn: Brighton Beach Avenue - 4th Street (East)
703317f-a.text:
(1)
Brighton Beach Ave., south side, East 4th Street and Coney Island Avegg
sbowing the Brighton Beach Hotel, which was built by the Brighton Beach 9
Co., in 1878, and opened for business the same year. The work was
started on March 20, 1878. When this hotel was first erected it was
ESSEEEEE:EEETEEEETEET5EE 1
ever on April 3, 1888 it was moved inland 500 feet by B.C. Miller and 5
Sons who contracted the work. The hotel was razed in 1924. The owners'
or lessees of this hotel were Breslin and Sweet 1879, Leland 1883,
Cunningham and Hatfield 1888, and E. Clark King 1902-1909.
December 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(2)
The samie, viewed eastward,
December 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

703318f-a.title: Brooklyn: Brighton Beach Avenue - 4th Street
703318f-a.text:
Brighton Beach Avenue, south side, at East 4th Street
and Coney Island Avenue, showing the Brighton Beach Hotel. See
other views for more data.
December 31, 1938
Photographer Geo P. Hall \& Co.
Urbrock Collection
MAY BE REPRODUCED
